Here is a summary of the text in 10 bullet points of 4 sentences each:

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a skin reflectance measuring apparatus. The measurement of skin reflectance finds applications in pathology and cosmetology, such as studying seborrhea and other skin diseases, and measuring the effect of anti-reflectance products. Existing methods and devices used in industry for measuring surface reflectance are not applicable to measuring skin reflectance. A first problem is the influence of color, which can be overcome by using a relative measurement between specular and diffuse reflection.

* However, known devices using relative measurement remain inappropriate for measuring skin reflectance. Industrial apparatuses generally use optical systems with focusing lenses that require accurate positioning on a flat surface with a relatively large measuring area. For skin measurement, the measuring area needs to be small to keep skin characteristics uniform and avoid changing them by flattening the skin. An easy-to-handle measuring apparatus that does not require highly accurate positioning is important.

* The object of the present invention is to propose a reflectance measurement apparatus specifically adapted for measuring skin reflectance. The apparatus comprises a probe with a casing having an aperture, a flexible fiber optics connection with at least three optical conductors secured in the casing facing the aperture in specific directions, and a measuring device with light emitting and receiving means coupled to the optical conductors. The measuring device has processing means with correcting means to compensate for variations in emitted light and ambient light influence, producing a relative reflectance signal from measured specular and diffuse reflection values.

* A display device receives the reflectance signal to indicate its amplitude. The probe's structure, with fiber optics secured inside the casing, allows miniaturization for measurements on reduced surfaces (e.g., 10-50 mm2). This makes the apparatus readily usable, as the probe has reduced dimensions and is connected via a flexible connection. Unlike systems with focusing lenses requiring extremely accurate positioning, this apparatus can tolerate a few degrees of deviation between the probe and skin surface.

* Correction of variations in emitted light intensity and ambient light effect enables accurate measurement without strict operational conditions. Light intensity variations can be corrected by regulating the light source using servo-control means or by measuring the emitted light intensity to compensate for variations directly in the reflected light signals. The pressure modulation amplitude can be adjusted to servo-control instantaneous ventilation to at least equal a target ventilation.

• Sudden changes in leak are detected and handled using a fuzzy logic algorithm, by rapidly adjusting the leak airflow time constant if the airflow is a long way from zero for a long time compared to the expected breath duration. A modified airflow is calculated by multiplying the respiratory airflow by the fuzzy negation of a "sudden leak" index. This reduces the effects of sudden leaks on the derived respiratory airflow signal.

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points of 3 sentences each:

<summary>
* The invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, particularly in water-cooled generators with coaxial feed and discharge ducts. Special attention must be paid to eliminating air in the cooling system to avoid overheating and steam bubbles that can clog flow paths. The invention aims to automatically remove air bubbles accumulating in rotating pipes in a simple design.

* The invention solves the problem by providing at least one bypass with an inlet opening into the space around the axis of rotation and an outlet between the feed and discharge ducts. This utilizes the pressure gradient between inflow and outflow for automatic operation. The bypass can be arranged in the end face of the feed ducts, as a radially arranged pipe member, or as a coiled pipe.

* The bypass may include means for increasing hydrodynamic resistance to achieve adequate pressure drop over a short distance with low flow resistance, enabling a smaller ventilation system. FIG. 1 shows a first embodiment with the bypass arranged in the end face of the feed pipe. FIG. 2 depicts a second embodiment with the bypass as a T-pipe.

* FIG. 3 shows a third embodiment with the bypass as a radially arranged pipe including an insert with a spiral groove to increase hydrodynamic resistance. FIG. 4 depicts a fourth embodiment with the radial pipe bypass arranged at any point of the inner pipe, suitable for multiple radial feed ducts. Several such bypasses can be arranged in the inner pipe.

* FIG. 5 shows a fifth embodiment with the bypass as a coiled pipe arranged at one end of the outer pipe, with the inlet opening into the space around the axis of rotation. The long spiral pipe acts as a throttle. The bypass can also be arranged in any cross section of the inner pipe but may reduce its useful flow cross section.

* The ventilation system eliminates air bubbles by providing inlet openings around the axis of rotation where bubbles accumulate due to the lowest pressure point. The advantageously arranged inlet enables desired bypass flow to achieve the ventilating effects. While specific embodiments are shown, the invention may be embodied otherwise without departing from the inventive principles.
</summary>

The jacket unit is connected to the retaining part by an energy absorption connection with at least one deformable bending wire or strip, and a break-away connection that blocks displacement up to the force limit.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a finishing article with a permanently affixed mounting hub for quick attachment and release to a portable power tool.
• Previous designs used adhesives and keyways to secure the grinding wheel to the mounting hub, but these had disadvantages such as added manufacturing cost and bulk.
• The new design includes a backing flange with gripping means, a retaining nut that extends through the wheel and secures to the flange without adhesives, and a pressure cap held by the gripping means.
• The pressure cap engages the power tool spindle and places the abrasive wheel in compression during use for a secure hold.
• The backing flange has reinforcing ribs and lands that engage the back of the grinding wheel.
• The retaining nut is upset on the end to form a protrusion that overlaps the flange, securing the flange and nut together on the wheel.
• The pressure cap snaps onto the backing flange gripping means and includes stiffening ribs to carry the compressive forces.
• Attaching the wheel assembly to the threaded spindle generates a clamping force on the wheel between the flange and nut, which increases during use, preventing the wheel from rotating relative to the hub.
• This design accommodates various standard wheel sizes, is lightweight, vibration-free, less expensive than previous throw-away hubs, and meets safety standards.
</summary>

As the UHMW-PE matrix wears, new carbon black particulates are exposed, maintaining conductivity over time.

Here is a summary of the text in 7 bullet points of 3 sentences each:

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that produces energy from fluid pressure regulation. Prior art regulators result in a loss of energy between the high-pressure fluid entering and low-pressure fluid exiting. The invention aims to convert this potential energy into work.

* The fluid pressure regulator assembly comprises a pressurized fluid source, first and second means for transporting pressurized fluid, a fluid regulator coupled to the first and second means, and means coupled between the first means and regulator for converting pressurized fluid into mechanical power. In the preferred embodiment, the converting means is a vane pump that converts pressurized fluid into movement of the vanes, which can then be converted into rotational and/or electrical energy.

* The fluid regulator defines a high-pressure cavity in fluid communication with a low-pressure cavity via an opening. A valve stem in the opening is coupled to a threaded shaft with a compressed spring and resilient diaphragm that regulate pressure in the low-pressure cavity.

* The vane motor has a casing with an inlet coupled to the high-pressure line and an outlet. Inside are an outer race, inner drum with apertures, and perpendicular first and second vane assemblies with lost motion linkages allowing extension and retraction.

* As pressurized fluid enters the inlet, it presses against the vanes, rotating the inner drum and drum shaft counterclockwise. The vanes extend and retract to maximize forward torque and minimize reverse torque on the drum.

* The drive shaft of the motor is coupled to an electrical generator that sends current to a battery powering a rotisserie on a gas grill. Fluid flows from the tank through the motor, reducing pressure, then through the regulator for further pressure reduction before reaching the grill burner.

* Alternative embodiments include using multiple vane motors for generating electricity and mechanical work, and incorporating a vane motor in a scuba diver's compressed air system to power a headlight. The vane motor extracts work from pressurized fluid while reducing pressure, allowing use of a smaller, less expensive regulator.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.
* The apparatus comprises means for continuously supplying aluminum, an anodic oxidation bath with a cathode, an electrolytic coloring bath containing specific metal salts with an anode, an electric circuit connecting the cathode and anode to a power source, and means for passing the aluminum continuously through the baths.
* The anodic oxidation bath forms an oxide film on the aluminum, preferably 4-15 microns thick.
* The electrolytic coloring bath colors the anodized aluminum, with the color depending on the specific metal salts used and electrolytic conditions.
* The apparatus allows the aluminum to function as an anode in the anodic oxidation bath and a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath without directly connecting it to the power source.
* The aluminum strip passes successively through degreasing, etching, current supplying, anodic oxidation, electrolytic coloring, and sealing baths.
* Rheostats control the electric current supplied to the current supply bath and electrolytic coloring bath.
* The thickness of the oxide film is controlled by the current per unit area of aluminum in the anodic oxidation bath.
* The color is controlled by the composition of the electrolytic coloring bath, current density, and period of electrolysis.
* The apparatus can continuously produce colored anodized aluminum with superior weatherability at low cost.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a process for producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest. The vectors are adapted to integrate the DNA sequence of interest into the chromosome, and the DNA sequence contains portions from at least two vectors necessary for expressing a function of interest. Plants or cells expressing the function of interest are then selected.

* The process allows for rapid in planta assembly and optimization of DNA sequences for stable integration into the plant chromosome. It enables screening of libraries of coding or regulatory sequences and avoids the transfer of sequences through illicit gene transfer. The transgenic plants produced can be used for various purposes, and the assembled DNA sequence of interest may also serve as a precursor for downstream processes such as the formation of episomal vectors.

</summary>

<summary>
• This invention relates to an improved process for deacylating and desulfurizing triazolothiadiazines to produce pyrazolotriazoles. The improvement involves using hypophosphorous acid in the reaction to increase product yield and reduce unwanted impurities.

• Pyrazolotriazoles are useful magenta couplers for photography but are difficult to synthesize. One preferred route involves preparing triazolothiadiazines and subsequently desulfurizing them to pyrazolotriazoles in a two-step process.

• The first step is a ring contraction reaction by heating the triazolothiadiazine in acetic anhydride. The second step is hydrolysis of acetyl groups and simultaneous desulfurization with hydrochloric acid, which generates elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.

• Using hypophosphorous acid in the second step reduces the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur impurities formed. It results in H2S byproduct instead of sulfur, increases product yield, and does not reduce nitro groups that are commonly present.

• In a preferred embodiment, a triazolothiadiazine is reacted with an acylating agent to form an acylated intermediate, which is subsequently reacted with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric or hydrobromic acid. This generates less sulfur and sulfur impurities than when hypophosphorous acid is not used.

• Several examples are provided demonstrating the improved process. In one example, the desired pyrazolotriazole product was obtained in 82% yield and 98% purity when using hypophosphorous acid, compared to only 45-50% yield without it.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points of 4 sentences each:

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber bales by sequentially taking small partial quantities. In known methods, a carriage with a bale opener moves past fiber bales, taking partial quantities from each to achieve a desired mixture ratio. However, this can lead to residual fibers remaining in bales that disturb the operating rhythm and require additional processing. The known methods also only allow the mixture to be obtained in steps, preventing optimal homogeneity.

* The invention aims to eliminate these disadvantages by measuring the entire momentary quantity of each fiber bale before each pass of the bale opener. From these measurements, a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity is determined. This determined partial quantity is then continuously removed only from the measured fiber lot during that pass.

* In one embodiment, only the initial total quantity of each fiber bale is measured, and a constant partial quantity is calculated once. These partial quantities are then removed from the bales in succession over a fixed number of passes. This method is particularly suited for mixtures with constant quantity proportions.

* To avoid delays, the invention sets a predetermined time period for removing the partial quantities from each fiber lot. <summary>
• This application claims priority from a provisional patent application and pertains to methods and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments using non-eductive drawing.
• Conventional eductive "open" spinning systems and non-eductive "closed" spinning systems have various disadvantages and limitations related to turbulence, plugging, hygiene, spin speeds, and web formation control.
• The present invention involves an initial quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width which produces a linear plane of filaments with good control of cross-machine uniformity.
• The same quench fluid, usually air, is used to first quench the filaments and then draw them as it exits through the drawing impingement slot at high velocity.
• The quench air temperature, flow rate, slot opening length, and exhaust flow rate should be maintained within certain ranges to achieve the benefits of the invention.
• During start-up, the air knives forming the slot are retracted to allow filaments to fall through, and are then moved together to decrease the slot opening and draw the filaments.

• A web forming table positioned below the slot comprises a vacuum suction box for pulling down filaments onto a moving conveyor belt which transports the web for further processing.
• The method and apparatus of the invention are useful for making fine continuous filaments for various applications, including spunbond webs, pillow/cushion stuffing, and baled fibers.
</summary>

It includes first and second cams arranged on respective sides of a projection of the bobbin housing of a rotatable hook for controlling the rotation of the bobbin housing with the rotary hook housing which includes a spring rod extending between the cams which cooperate with the projection.

The fall protection tie-off ring on each support can be used to attach a safety cable that workers can tie

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points of 3 sentences each:

<summary>
• The invention relates to techniques for more accurately measuring fluid pressure in geological formations at desired depths using pressure sensors. The pressure sensor inlet is isolated in the borehole using cement grout so it only measures formation pressure adjacent to the sensor, not pressures from other depths. A fluid path is opened between the sensor inlet and the formation through the cement grout to allow formation fluid pressure to reach the sensor.

• In one embodiment, a pressure transducer is lowered into a borehole to the desired depth and cement grout is pumped in. Fluid is then pumped through a conduit and check valve to the transducer inlet to clear grout and create a path to the formation before the grout fully sets. The transducer measures the formation pressure through this path while isolated from other borehole pressures by the set grout.

• In another embodiment, a conduit with a filter on the bottom end is placed in the borehole and filled with fluid. Cement grout is pumped into the borehole, then fluid is pumped through the conduit to clear the filter and create a formation path. After the grout sets, a pressure transducer is lowered into the conduit and sealed with a packer to measure formation pressure through the path.

• The borehole can optionally be fractured after grout sets by pumping high pressure fluid through the conduit and filter to extend the formation connection. A chronological pressure record during installation shows borehole and grout hydrostatic pressures, followed by a decline and recovery to formation pressure. Fluid injection can be used to maintain pressure near formation pressure during grout setting.

• The inlet filter prevents grout and debris from entering the conduit, but can be omitted in some cases with the open conduit end serving as the inlet. The transducer in the second embodiment can be removed for servicing or relocated to different depths. Pressure readings can be transmitted to surface monitoring equipment via electrical cable.

• The invention allows isolating the pressure sensor inlet to accurately measure formation pressure at a specific depth without influence from other borehole pressures. Various changes in details can be made to the pressure sensing systems and methods as engineering choices while still applying the key principles of the invention.
</summary>

Here is a 6-sentence summary of the text:

Here is a 9-sentence summary of the passage in 3 bullet points of 3 sentences each:

<summary>
• The present invention relates to systems and methods for heating oil and gas wells to improve production when flow is impeded due to high oil viscosity or paraffin blockage. Existing down hole heating technologies are ineffective because the heat is not properly focused in the production zone and the electrical components are not adequately protected from pressure and corrosive fluids. The present down hole heating system addresses these shortcomings to provide a more effective solution.

• The key components of the system include a heating unit with electrical resistance rods, a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, and stainless steel collars to focus the heat on the production zone. The electrical connections between the power leads and heater rods are encased in high temperature cement and a steel fitting assembly to shield them from pressure and corrosion. Solid copper leads with KAPTON insulation are used to reliably deliver power to the heating unit.

• The method of using the down hole heating system involves installing the heating unit and heat-retaining components to focus heat on the producing formation. The system can also be used with a wire line to heat-treat wells before reinserting production tubing, which is particularly beneficial for treating deep gas wells with iron sulfide occlusion problems. The invention provides a more effective solution for increasing production from oil and gas wells with flow problems.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points of 2 sentences each:

<summary>
* This invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including stuck or lost objects. The mechanism can take the form of an external overshot or an internal spear pull tool.

* A catch mechanism with a locking and unlocking position secures the outer body about the inner body. Pin structures in the catch mechanism enter pin receiving grooves, and a control spring ensures the pin alternates between unlocking and locking grooves as the inner and outer bodies move relative to each other.

* If the tool is locked to the object, unlocking is achieved by downward then upward movement of the tool. If unlocked, locking is achieved by downward then upward movement.

* The drawings show axial sectional views of the tool with an expandable collet or external teeth for gripping objects. Fragmentary views show details of the catch mechanism.

* An alternative embodiment is an overshot type tool for grappling objects. It has a similar catch mechanism with pin receiving grooves and a control spring.

* The overshot tool has an adjustable spacer tube and abutment element to position the grappling teeth when latching. Guide pins project into latching recesses and are controlled by the control spring to induce rotational guidance as the pins move.

* Latching and unlatching cycles can be repeated indefinitely without removing the tool from the well bore. If undersized for the pulling operation, the tool can be unlatched, removed, and replaced with a heavier duty tool.

* The invention is intended for installing, removing, and fishing operations for various downhole tools and objects. Other embodiments may be employed within the teachings of the invention.
</summary>

Here is a 40-sentence summary of the passage in 10 bullet points of 4 sentences each:

<summary>

* The invention relates to position and motion sensors, particularly for monitoring moving parts in mechanical systems like diesel engine fuel injectors. Sensors for each moving part can be wired to a remote monitoring system, but this adds cost and weight. Reducing the amount of wiring can be achieved by having the sensor draw a current proportional to the position of the monitored object. Further wire reduction is possible by multiplexing multiple sensors on the same wires, with the monitoring system using timing information to identify which sensor signal is being sampled.

* Position sensors generate an electrical signal proportional to the distance between the moving object and a fixed point, but unwanted noise signals are also generated. Higher frequency noise can be filtered out, but low frequency noise in the form of DC offset or drift is a significant portion of the total signal. This DC offset causes problems in two-wire current output sensors by increasing power dissipation, reducing maximum operating temperature and reliability, and leaving less power for the sensor itself.

* The invention is a sensor comprising a waveform generator that modifies an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer using an error correction signal, and an error correction generator that provides the error correction signal. The error correction generator has a comparator to determine the value of the conditioned sensing signal, a controller that provides timing signals based on this value, and a signal processor that generates the error correction signal using the timing signals. This allows the sensor to connect to remote monitoring equipment using only two wires for multiplexing multiple sensors.

* The error correction generator determines and eliminates static and error signals that do not provide position information and waste energy. It uses a closed-loop compensation circuit to constantly compare the conditioned sensing signal to a desired minimum value and generate a correction signal to subtract the offset and error, keeping the sensor output close to the minimum. The comparison proceeds slowly relative to object motion so the generated position signals are not significantly subtracted, but fast relative to the object motion so noise and errors can be deleted.

* The sensor has a window reference circuit that compares the desired conditioned sensor output to the actual output and adjusts it if outside preset high or low reference signals. The signal processor generates a small reference signal to eliminate small negative drift without generating significant calibration voltage signal, and a large reference signal exceeding the maximum sensor

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points, with each bullet point containing exactly 1 sentence:

<summary>
* The invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions of a four-stroke piston in internal combustion engines.
* The system eliminates the need for springs by using a cam and translating means to control valve position in a substantially infinitely variable manner.
* The cam has a grooved track that displaces a translating means, which reciprocates to achieve linear movement of the valve.
* A rotatable link with a slot allows the valve to move up and down based on the angle the slot makes with the line of action of the translating means.
* An adjustable member rotates the link to control the amount of valve port opening, and this can be adjusted to keep the valve closed while the engine is still running.
* The system allows precise control of the amount of air/fuel mixture entering each piston, and can close valves in selected cylinders while the engine runs on the remaining cylinders.
* The valve sequencing and timing is controlled by cam grooves on a single input cam, providing a simple and robust system compared to typical cam-spring valve actuation.
* The system can be extended to engines with multiple valves per cylinder by using a multi-fingered drive link with duplicate actuating mechanisms for each valve.
</summary>

Here is a 6-sentence summary of the passage in 3 bullet points:

Here is a 6-sentence summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>

It can effectively burn wet wood waste by forming a conical pile of fuel fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile to dry and gasify the fuel.

The gases then pass around an air-cooled flame holder into a secondary combustion chamber where secondary air is introduced to complete combustion.

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points, with 2 sentences each:

<summary>
* The invention is an evaporative air conditioner that separates the evaporating water from the useful cooling air using a heat exchanger. It operates more efficiently by using return air from the cooled enclosure as the working air on the wet side of the heat exchanger.

* The heat exchanger has an array of vertical tubes with water flowing down the inner surfaces and working air flowing upward, while useful air passes externally across the tubes. Additional efficiency can be gained by flowing the exhaust working air in heat exchange with the incoming fresh air.

* A hybrid system incorporates a vapor compression refrigeration unit to cool a small portion of the useful air below its dew point for dehumidification. This further reduces the wet bulb temperature of the working air, increasing the heat exchanger effectiveness and cooling the useful air more.

* The refrigeration unit's condenser is placed in the heat exchanger's wet side exhaust stream for more efficient operation. The overall system provides cooling comparable to a larger conventional air conditioner while using significantly less power.
</summary>

• The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
• Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes, and examples include Diels-Alder reactions and Staudinger ligations.
• The method allows the CARS-active scattering cross section of the target to be increased or generated by suitable synthesis reactions, enabling improved specificity and sensitivity compared to conventional methods.
• Advantageous bioorthogonal reactions include modified Huisgen cycloaddition, nitrone dipolar cycloaddition, norbornene cycloaddition, (4+1) cycloaddition, and oxanorbornadiene cycloaddition.
• The method can be used to equip a structure of the sample that does not intrinsically have a resonance site with a resonance site, allowing reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background.
• The invention is illustrated with examples where an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample is coupled to a reaction partner containing a resonance site, either directly or via a coupler molecule.
• A CARS microscope that can be used in the method is described, which includes lasers for generating pump and Stokes light beams, and detectors for sensing the resonance signal.
• The method involves steps of furnishing a sample, performing a bioorthogonal reaction to introduce a resonance site, introducing the sample into an investigation system, investigating the sample, and sensing the signal to derive structural properties.
• The invention enables improved specificity and sensitivity in CARS microscopy by introducing resonance sites through bioorthogonal reactions, and allows reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an improved data processing system and apparatus for accelerating floating point operations, particularly the effective subtraction operation. Floating point numbers are represented by a fraction value and an exponent argument value, and addition/subtraction operations are more complex due to the need to align fractions and potentially normalize the result. The effective subtraction operation includes addition of operands with differing signs and subtraction of operands with the same sign.

• The related art performs effective subtraction by determining the exponent difference, aligning the smaller operand, subtracting, taking the 2's complement if negative, finding the leading 1, normalizing, and rounding - a total of 7 time-consuming steps. When the difference is >1, the larger operand is known, avoiding the need for negation, and normalization/rounding can be combined into one step.

• When the exponent difference is ≤1, alignment can be done "on the fly" during subtraction, and either normalization or rounding (but not both) are needed, reducing the 7 steps to 5. Further acceleration is achieved by beginning the subtraction based on the difference between a subset of the least significant bits of the exponents, before the full exponent difference is calculated. The subset size is chosen such that if the full difference implies a different result, the correct result will simply be one of the original operand fractions.

• For example, if the 6-bit difference TDELTA(E) is 0, the computation of FRACTION A - FRACTION B begins. If the full difference DELTA(E) is 0 this is correct; if DELTA(E) ≥ 64 the result is FRACTION A; if DELTA(E) ≤ -64 the result is FRACTION B. Similar logic applies for TDELTA(E) of 1 or -1.

Here is a 16-sentence summary of the passage in 4 bullet points of 4 sentences each:

<summary>
* The passage describes a system and method for performing design rule checks (DRC) on integrated circuits (ICs) with both logic and memory regions. Conventional DRC methods apply the same logic rules to the entire IC layout, resulting in many false errors in memory regions which have different design rules. The invention solves this by applying different design rule checks to the logic regions and the various memory regions (SRAM, DRAM, ROM, etc.). This eliminates false errors and allows the different regions to be checked according to their specific design rules.

* To implement the invention, the IC layout is divided into logic and memory regions, with each memory region further identified by a memory type. Logic design rules are applied to the logic regions, while customized design rules are applied to each type of memory region. The customized memory design rules are derived by modifying the logic design rules based on the actual design rules for each type of memory cell.

* The customized memory design rules are created by first performing a design rule check on a memory cell layout using the standard logic rules. This check will flag violations of the logic rules by the memory cell. These violations are then analyzed to determine how the logic design rules should be modified to accommodate the memory cell's actual design rules. The modified logic rules, with more liberal parameter values "pushed" onto them, become the customized design rules for that memory type.

* By applying the appropriate set of design rules to each region of the IC layout, the system avoids false errors and provides a more efficient and reliable design rule check. The result is a design rule check report with real logic and memory errors clearly distinguished. This allows circuit designs to be implemented in silicon more quickly. The method can be extended to any type of IC with mixed circuit types having different design rules.
</summary>

• This invention pertains to using waveguide holograms as illuminators for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators. The illumination system comprises a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source like a laser.

• Waveguide holograms (WGHs) are flat and can be optically contacted to the objects they illuminate, providing a compact and rugged arrangement compared to conventional lens systems. WGHs can achieve very high diffraction efficiency approaching 0.99, and the undiffracted light is trapped in the waveguide, resulting in an efficiency ratio E≥0.999.

• Some challenges with WGHs include critical alignment of laser beams, time delay across the hologram, and nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction. Illumination depletion occurs as light is diffracted out of the waveguide at each point, making the reconstructed image nonuniform if the hologram is recorded uniformly.

• Illumination depletion can be compensated for a priori by recording the hologram nonuniformly so the reconstructed beam is uniform, or a posteriori by exposing a photographic negative to absorb more light where the beam is brightest. WGHs also tend to produce two diffracted beams, one out of each side, which can be addressed by absorbing or reflecting the unutilized beam.

• Alignment sensitivity can be combatted by firmly attaching the light source to the waveguide or using a broad source and allowing the waveguide to select the properly matched light. WGHs can achieve high spectral selectivity of about 2-5 Å due to double selection by the hologram and waveguide.

• When illuminating SLMs, polarized light can be diffracted out and the SLM used to modulate polarization, with analyzers controlling the unmodulated light. Precise reflective systems using phase modulation can cause selective interference between the emitted and reflected beams.

• Two basic architectures were used to record the WGH grating: a modified conventional holographic recording system with a cubic glass prism to create a steep reference beam

Here is a 6-sentence summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

The prior art cards can be subject to damage from bending stresses, and securing the electronic components with glue or mechanical means is complicated and increases production costs. Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 4 bullet points of 3 sentences each:

<summary>

* The invention relates to implementing a queue, particularly a FIFO queue, in a functional memory where updates are made by copying the path from the root to the point of updating and making the update in the copy. The queue is implemented and maintained using a tree-shaped structure with nodes of a given maximum size. Additions are directed to the first non-full node on the first edge of the tree, while deletions are directed to a leaf node on the opposite edge.

* The tree-shaped structure maintains the leaf nodes at the same hierarchy level by creating new nodes when a non-full node is not present during additions. This allows each update to require time and space logarithmically dependent on the queue length, as only the path from the root to the update point needs to be copied. The node to be updated is easily accessed by following the edge of the tree until a leaf node is found.

* A preferred embodiment includes a separate header node with three elements pointing to nodes constituting the end, middle (the tree-shaped structure), and beginning of the queue. Additions fill the end node first before adding to the tree, while deletions remove an entire leaf node from the tree and make it the beginning node. This reduces the need to update the tree for every addition or deletion.

* The queue is symmetrical and can be inverted in constant time and space by using an identifier in the header node to indicate which separate nodes are the beginning and end. Changing the identifier's value interprets the queue in the opposite direction and the tree structure as a mirror image. This allows the queue to be used as a double-ended queue (deque).

</summary>

Here is a 6-sentence summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
• The invention relates to embedded EPROM devices that can be manufactured using existing DRAM or logic IC technologies. The key element is using a DRAM storage capacitor as the coupling capacitor of the EPROM memory cell, allowing EPROM devices to be made without additional manufacturing cost.

• Another way to build embedded EPROM devices using existing technologies is to utilize the permanent changes in transistor properties caused by electrical stress conditions. These "stress effect programmable read only memory" (SEPROM) devices represent data using the differences in properties between stressed data devices and reference devices.

• SEPROM devices have the advantages of being able to be manufactured by any IC technology, store large amounts of data at low cost, and secure data from physical analysis. However, writing data to SEPROM can take longer and they have limited re-programmability compared to floating gate EPROM devices.
</summary>

Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 4 bullet points of 3 sentences each:

<summary>

* The method of determining feedback gain involves provisionally determining a feedback gain value, executing feedback control using that value, detecting the error between the designated and actual values, and calculating an evaluation value based on the error. This process is repeated for different feedback gain values. Finally, the feedback gain value that provides a suitable evaluation value is calculated based on the relationship between the feedback gain values and evaluation values.

* For determining the proportional gain, the ratio between the length of the error curve plotted against time and the length of the time axis is used as the evaluation value, and the feedback gain value that minimizes this evaluation value is selected. For the integral gain, the error is integrated to calculate the evaluation value, and the feedback gain value that results in an evaluation value closest to zero is chosen. For the differential gain, the absolute value of the error is integrated to calculate the evaluation value, and again, the feedback gain value producing an evaluation value nearest to zero is selected.

* This method is applied to controlling an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV). The lateral deviation of the AGV from a guide wire is detected, and this error signal is used by the steering angle controller to steer the vehicle to minimize the deviation.

* Two embodiments are described - in the first, the optimum P, I and D gain values are determined separately for each section of the AGV's running course, while in the second embodiment, the gain values are continuously updated as the AGV traverses the entire course. Evaluation functions suited to each type of gain are used to efficiently find the optimum values without complicated analysis.

</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points, with 2 sentences per bullet point:

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches. The apparatus determines if the driven disc assembly is excessively warped and generates an external indication of whether it is good or bad.

• In a clutch, a driven disc assembly is disposed between the pressure plate and flywheel, and is frictionally engaged when the pressure plate moves toward the flywheel. The driven disc assembly must be manufactured to close tolerances and not be excessively warped, otherwise the pressure plate may undesirably contact it when disengaged.

• A prior manual test fixture for measuring warpage of a driven disc assembly was somewhat slow, inefficient, and provided no external indication of test results. An improved automatic spin checking apparatus that determines if the assembly is good or bad and externally indicates the results is desired.

• The automatic spin checking apparatus includes a stationary ring and movable ring that frictionally engage the driven disc assembly, a torque motor to rotate the assembly, and means to measure the distance between the rings. The difference in ring distances before and after the assembly rotates under the torque motor is compared to a standard to determine if warpage is excessive.

• The apparatus includes a rigid test enclosure with the stationary ring secured to one end plate and the movable ring journalled for sliding movement on shafts. A servo motor rotates a ball screw shaft to move the movable ring toward and away from the stationary ring.

• An electronic position sensor measures the distance between the rings. A torque motor rotates a splined hub upon which the driven disc assembly is mounted.

• A microprocessor-based control system reads signals from an optical encoder on the torque motor, the position sensor, a sensor on the servo motor, and control switches. The microprocessor controls the torque and servo motors and a display to indicate test status.

• The microprocessor executes a program to close the rings to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly, energize the torque motor, gradually open the rings until the assembly rotates, measure this ring separation distance, and compare it to a standard to determine if warpage is within tolerance, actuating the display accordingly.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points, with 2 sentences per bullet point for a total of 18 sentences:

<summary>

* The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention allows almost any motion picture to be viewed with a 3-dimensional effect. It uses Pulfrich glasses with lenses that can be individually controlled to be clear or darkened.

* The Pulfrich effect creates a 3D illusion when lateral motion in a movie is viewed with one eye through a darkened lens. The 3-D Phenomenoscope has a digital sensor, processor, and lens control algorithm to detect lateral motion and synchronize the lens states.

* The lenses have 3 states: both clear when no motion is detected, left clear/right dark when left-to-right motion is detected, and left dark/right clear when right-to-left motion is detected. More complex motion and lens states can be used in other embodiments.

* The Glass Lens Controller Unit (GLCU) contains a digital sensor to capture movie frames, a processor running a lens control algorithm, and circuits to control the lens states. The algorithm compares successive frames to detect lateral motion and determine lens synchronization.

* The preferred embodiment uses an intensity edge algorithm to identify a prominent vertical edge in one frame and look for its movement in the next frame. If the edge moves left-to-right, the left lens is clear and right lens dark; if it moves right-to-left, the left lens is dark and right lens clear.

* The algorithm first tries to detect a vertical edge. If found, it looks for that same edge in the next frame and determines if the edge has moved laterally.

* If lateral motion is detected between frames, the direction (left-to-right or right-to-left) is determined. The left and right lenses are then set to clear-dark or dark-clear respectively to create the 3D effect.

* Other embodiments can use more complex algorithms to track multiple edges, estimate parallax and speed of motion, and control lens states. The algorithm may also account for confounding factors like head movement.

* A decision procedure is continuously applied to successive movie frames to determine if a synchronization event is detected. If so, the lenses are set based on the direction of motion; otherwise, both lenses are set to clear.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die without using a wafer saw. Trenches are formed along the scribe lines on the wafer, and then mechanical pressure is applied to cause a clean break along the trenches, singulating the individual die. The method includes applying a photo resist layer, patterning it to expose the scribe lines, etching trenches along the scribe lines, and optionally back-grinding the wafer to reduce its thickness.

• An adhesive tape is applied to the back surface of the wafer, and the wafer is placed active-side down on a soft pad. Mechanical pressure is applied to the back surface of the wafer in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion to break the wafer along the trenches and singulate the die. A ring is used to hold the wafer in place on the pad during the singulation process.

• The method avoids problems associated with using a wafer saw, such as the slow process of cutting each scribe line individually, the need for periodic maintenance and blade replacement, and chipping along the cut edges which can damage die and reduce yields. The invention can be used with any size wafer and any type of die, and the final wafer thickness and trench depth can be varied as needed for the specific application.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 5 bullet points, with 2 sentences per bullet point for a total of 10 sentences:

<summary>
* The invention relates to a field emission display (FED) device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission components. The protection structure uses at least one reduction plate or electrode to deflect ionic emission gas away from the field emission components.

* In an FED, electrons emitted from a cathode strike phosphors on an anode to produce light. To achieve high efficiency, the FED is evacuated to low pressure and the emitter source material must be clean and uniform.

* Conventional FED devices using microtip emitters require complicated fabrication steps with many photomasking processes. Co-pending applications disclose FEDs using nanotube emitters that can be fabricated more simply and at lower cost.

* During FED operation, emitted electrons can ionize oxygen and nitrogen gas, and the ions can discharge to the cathode causing current surges that damage the field emission elements. The present invention provides a protection structure with reduction plates or electrodes to alter the discharge path of the ions and prevent damage.

* The reduction plates can be interspersed among the field emission elements in various configurations, such as parallel to rows of emitters or in a mesh/net pattern. A voltage source applies a negative charge to the reduction plates to attract the positive ions and prevent them from reaching the cathode.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an image sensor that can record information through an edge surface of the sensor. It overcomes problems in prior art image sensors that could only image in a single plane.

* The image sensor has an elongated P-type semiconductor substrate with imaging planes on the top surface and two edge surfaces. Three columns of image sensor elements are formed in the substrate, one for each imaging plane.

* Each image sensor element includes an image sensing region where charge carriers are generated by light, and a charge collection and transfer means which is a buried-channel CCD. P+ layers are formed between the edge surfaces and adjacent columns of sensor elements.

* The increased doping in the P+ layers creates a barrier guiding charge carriers generated at the edges toward the middle of the substrate. The charge carriers then diffuse laterally and are collected by the CCDs near the edges.

* The thickness of the lightly-doped upper layer determines the effective vertical aperture dimension at the edges. Common epitaxial layer thicknesses of 1-20 microns cover the range needed for most CCD detectors.

* In a second embodiment, the lightly-doped N-type CCD regions are extended to the edges of the sensor. This increases the lateral depletion region, improving charge collection and reducing crosstalk.

* The image sensor can be used to simultaneously image multiple planes, such as for color applications with red, green and blue filters over the different imaging planes. This allows scanning a color document in a single pass.
</summary>

Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 6 bullet points:

<summary>
• The invention relates to a technique for realizing a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) Precoder for multi-user MIMO systems that significantly reduces computational cost while maintaining capacity. The technique relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise" and provides a uniform framework for realizing the GDFE Precoder.

• The method involves computing a filter matrix C using one of several alternative formulas, then computing the transmit filter matrix B, feedforward filter matrix F, and interference pre-cancellation matrix G based on C. Several numerical examples are provided to illustrate the computation of the GDFE Precoder matrices under different scenarios.

• When the covariance matrix of the "Least Favorable Noise" is known, the filter matrix C is computed using equation (12). When this covariance matrix is unknown, alternative equations (22) or (26) are used to compute C, depending on the dimensions of the channel matrix H.

• The transmit filter matrix B is computed as B = VΣ1/2M, where the columns of M are obtained from the QR decomposition of C. The effective feedforward filter F is obtained by extracting block diagonal sub-matrices from the upper triangular matrix R in the QR decomposition of C.

• The interference pre-cancellation matrix G has a block upper triangular structure and is computed as G = FR-1. Numerical examples demonstrate that under certain conditions, not all data streams are allocated transmit power, resulting in some streams being turned off.

• The described GDFE Precoder can be implemented in software executed by a digital signal processor and is well-suited for high speed digital cellular telephony and other forms of digital communication. The methods provide improved spectral efficiency for MU-MIMO systems at reasonable computational costs.
</summary>

* The invention provides a receiver input circuit that substantially eliminates undesired signal actuation of non-linear components resulting in distortions. It uses conventional components while taking into account adequate small signal behavior.

* The circuit includes several amplification control loops, with control signals derived from different stages. The first and second control loops within the input circuit avoid overloading of the mixer stage and varactor diodes.

* A third control loop can support the other loops with a lower effective bandwidth and signal response threshold. Its response threshold may be controlled by the second loop's control signal to lower amplification even for small signals in the presence of strong spurious signals.

* An embodiment includes an input network with PIN diodes for controllable attenuation, a preamplifier, mixer/oscillator, IF filter, rectifier circuits, and control signal processing. The PIN diode is controlled by distributing operating current between it and a shunt resistor.

* Rectifier circuits are arranged to prevent signal distortions from affecting the input circuit. Leveling of the control signal is done so the capacitor charges quickly to the highest signal level but follows decreasing levels slowly.

* Further embodiments include extended input networks with additional PIN diodes and reactances for greater control range and selectivity. During control, the source impedance for the preamplifier transistor increases, amplifying the control effect through increased negative current feedback without substantially raising noise.

</summary>

<summary>

The device loads and runs algorithms to perform the steps of generating salience maps, determining similarity, selecting the best clip, and inserting it into the video sequence.

Here is a summary of the text in 3 bullet points, with 2 sentences each:

<summary>
• The invention relates to using a recessed mask structure to prevent high electrical fields at intersections in small semiconductor devices. This results in lower electrical breakdown in high speed, high density integrated circuits and chip interconnects with fine metal features and low-k dielectrics.

• In the invention, a differentiating mask member is positioned 0.5-20 nm below the surface to be planarized, where electric fields are lower. This protects the dielectric during processing and maintains the integrity of the conductive liner diffusion barrier.

• The recessed mask structure provides several benefits, including moving high field points away from the cap-mask interface, minimizing high-k mask material to reduce overall capacitance, and preventing metal migration through the diffusion barrier. This results in faster signal propagation and a lower, more predictable overall capacitance in the interconnect wiring.
</summary>

Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 6 bullet points:

<summary>
* This invention is a downconverting digitizer that converts a modulated intermediate frequency (IF) signal to a digital representation of the baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components. It utilizes predictive coding principles by placing a sampler inside a predictive loop, allowing the predictive loop filter to be implemented using digital signal processing (DSP) techniques.

* The predictive filter output is re-mapped into the analog domain using a digital-to-analog converter (DAC) and subtracted from the input analog signal to generate the prediction error signal. The dynamic range is extended by using the digital output of the loop to control a variable gain amplifier at the input, and DC offset performance is enhanced through an offset nulling digital signal processing element.

* The sampler converts the loop error signal from analog to digital representation, and the predictive filter generates a prediction of the modulated IF at the next sampling epoch. The digital implementation of the predictive filter allows its frequency response to be reprogrammed to match the input signal.

* An automatic gain control (AGC) loop maintains the amplitude of the modulated IF signal within the dynamic range of the predictive loop. The offset nuller loop dynamically determines and removes offsets that would otherwise impair the analog-to-digital conversion.

* A digital quadrature mixer (DQM) downconverts the output of the predictive filter to baseband I and Q components, and rate reduction filters perform filtering and sample rate reduction on these components. The invention was implemented and verified as part of a wireless telephone receiver using a 0.6 micron CMOS semiconductor process.

* Measurements showed the implemented downconverting digitizer provided over 52 dB of dynamic range, equivalent to a dual 8-bit baseband ADC while performing IF to baseband downconversion with reduced noise. The designed AGC loop extended the dynamic range to over 124 dB.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process for producing multilayered electrical components such as capacitors. Conventional processes involve casting ceramic slips, printing electrode matrices, stacking and laminating printed sheets, cutting, firing, metallizing ends, and testing. The controls needed to achieve desired capacitance values include dielectric thickness, dielectric constant, electrode area, and number of active layers.

* The new process greatly simplifies manufacturing by eliminating the most costly steps. It involves providing electrodes and electrical components, locating the electrodes in recesses formed by the components to produce laminate sub-assemblies, and stacking the sub-assemblies to form a resultant assembly. Multiple electrodes and components can be formed on decals to produce the sub-assemblies.

* Additional aspects include interconnecting electrodes in stacked sub-assemblies, locating sub-assemblies in precise registered relation, building up stacks with covering components, and fabricating assemblies of many sizes at low cost and high production rates. The invention also provides apparatus and tooling to enable the fabrication, as well as the resultant sub-assemblies and assemblies themselves.

* The process uses prepared decals with registration holes and a release agent coating. Electrodes are screen printed onto the decals in a desired pattern. Electrical component material is then deposited onto part of each electrode and the decal to produce laminate sub-assemblies.

* The sub-assemblies are brought into stacked relation by displacing the decals for precision registration and removing the decals. No large laminating force is required because the electrodes are flush with the component surfaces, preventing density distortions that previously led to delamination problems. The stacks are placed on setters for drying and firing.

* More complex electrode configurations can be used in practice. Examples include T-shaped electrodes that are sunk into recesses in the components and protrude at the ends and sides. Cover sub-assemblies with protruding electrode material are used at the top and bottom of the stack.

* Upon firing, the protruding electrodes soften and fuse together, forming a multi-plate capacitor with end terminations. This allows a five-fold reduction in capacitor size and eliminates shape limitations. It also enables in-process

Here is a summary of the text in 9 bullet points, with 3 sentences each:

<summary>
• The disclosure describes a hierarchical lattice structure comprising unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice with improved specific stiffness and strength. The unit cells can have different geometries like tetrahedral, pyramidal, octet truss, or Kagome. The materials used to construct the cells can include metals, metal alloys, polymers, ceramics, glasses, and composites.

• A primary array of unit cells can be replicated in two dimensions and joined together at nodes. An ancillary array of unit cells can be nested with the primary array such that ligaments of the ancillary array cells abut with ligaments of the primary array cells. Two oppositely oriented lattice structures, each comprised of a primary array, can be mated together by abutting their ligaments.

• Solid or open cell face sheets can be attached to the top and/or bottom of the lattice structures. The lattice structures can be curved to form shapes like arcs, cylinders, or nozzles. They have applications as cores for sandwich panels, impact/blast energy absorption, cross-flow heat exchange, and high surface area catalyst supports.

• Unit cell arrays can be fabricated by injection molding thermoplastic polymers, reaction injection molding, metal injection molding, or ceramic injection molding. A polymer unit cell array can be used as a template - it can be carbonized and then have materials like silicon carbide deposited on it by chemical vapor deposition, with the polymer then removed by burnout to leave a hollow lattice.

• Alternatively, a polymer unit cell array can be used for investment casting - the array is coated in casting slurry, the polymer is burned out to leave a hollow slurry template, molten metal is poured in, and the slurry is removed to produce a metal lattice. Individual hexagonal pieces can also be deformed and joined to make tetrahedral unit cells that are then nested and joined into a lattice.

• The hierarchical lattice structures can be manufactured in various other ways including lattice block construction, constructed metal lattice, and metal textile lay-up techniques. Various aspects may be implemented with methods, systems, devices and compositions disclosed in several listed U.S. and international patent applications.

Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 4 bullet points of 3 sentences each:

<summary>
• The process co-produces power and hydrocarbons by integrating a coal-to-liquid (CTL) facility and an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) facility. The CTL facility includes dry gasification to produce synthesis gas for hydrocarbon synthesis. The IGCC facility includes wet gasification to produce combustion gas for power generation.

• A portion of the combustion gas from the IGCC facility is enriched with hydrogen and mixed with the synthesis gas from the CTL facility. The combined synthesis gas is used to synthesize hydrocarbons via Fischer-Tropsch synthesis. The remaining combustion gas is used to generate power in the IGCC facility.

• The two facilities share an air separation unit, CO2 and water separation, CO2 compression, and water treatment. Fuel gas from the CTL facility is used in the IGCC facility's waste heat boiler. Integrating the facilities improves overall efficiency and economies of scale.

• CO2 from the CTL facility is compressed with oxygen and used in the IGCC facility's combustor, resulting in an exhaust gas of mainly CO2 and water. This allows the CO2 to be captured, combined with additional CO2 from the CTL facility, and made available for sequestration or other uses.
</summary>

* Various insulating films such as silicon nitride, aluminum nitride, oxidized aluminum, etc. can be used for this purpose. After the film is formed, oxygen is added and heat treated so that the surface of the material can be superconductive, maintaining the ideal oxygen concentration when kept at liquid nitrogen temperature.
</summary>

Here is a 9-point summary of the passage:

<summary>
* The invention relates to seismometers designed to operate on the ocean floor and provides a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination assumed by the unit during operation and for leveling the seismic motion detectors.
* Ocean bottom seismometers (OBS's) are used in deep water oil and gas exploration but pose challenges in positioning the unit to provide good seismic coupling to the earth.
* The invention provides a simple way to determine the angle of inclination assumed by the OBS on the ocean floor and an apparatus for preserving the orientation for later measurement of that angle.
* The invention also provides a method and apparatus for automatically leveling the seismic motion detectors used in the OBS for proper operation.
* One or more seismic motion detectors are suspended at the end of a shaft protruding from a ball rotating in an annular seat to form a free moving pendulum.
* A spring-loaded plunger, restrained by a pin connected to a solenoid, is released to lock the ball, shaft and detector in their assumed position after the OBS is positioned.
* The angle of inclination can later be determined by measuring the acute angle formed by the ball, shaft and detector in their locked position compared to the vertical.
* The detectors, support means, solenoid and plunger are preferably mounted to the door of a water-tight instrument housing rigidly mounted to the OBS frame resting on the ocean floor.
* This rigid connection from detector to frame provides good acoustic coupling of seismic waves traveling through the ocean floor to the detector for better recording.
</summary>

Here is a 9-sentence summary of the passage in 3 bullet points of 3 sentences each:

<summary>
• The humidity sensing element comprises a first electron conductive electrode, a porous dielectric coating, minute electron conductive particles deposited in the dielectric, a second electron conductive electrode, and an ion-forming material contacting the particles and second electrode. The impedance between the electrodes varies linearly with the relative humidity when excited by an alternating current voltage. The preferred embodiment uses an aluminum first electrode, anodized dielectric, nickel particles, hydrolized and sealed dielectric, and vacuum deposited nickel second electrode.

• The manufacturing method involves coating the first electrode with a porous dielectric, depositing electron conductive particles in the dielectric, contacting the particles with an ion-forming material, and forming a second electrode on the opposite side of the dielectric. Preferably, the first electrode is anodized aluminum, nickel particles are vacuum deposited, the dielectric is hydrolized and sealed, and the second electrode is vacuum deposited nickel. Specific dimensions, materials, and processes are described for the preferred embodiment.

• The sensor functions based on the combination of capacitance, which increases with water vapor molecules, and resistance, which increases with temperature, resulting in an impedance that varies inversely with relative humidity. Excitation with a 10 Hertz AC voltage provides good linearity for typical textile mill conditions. Specific limitations and conditions for proper functioning are described.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the source text in 8 bullet points of 2 sentences each:

<summary>
* Before September 2001, there were significant vulnerabilities in aviation security, including weaknesses in screening passengers and baggage, controlling airport access, and protecting air traffic control systems. To address these weaknesses, the Aviation and Transportation Security Act (ATSA) created the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) and established security requirements with mandated deadlines.

* Since its creation, TSA has worked to meet the aviation security deadlines set by ATSA, such as deploying federal passenger screeners, screening all checked baggage, and expanding the Federal Air Marshal Service. However, TSA has experienced some difficulties meeting these deadlines and goals.

* TSA is pursuing initiatives to strengthen control over airport access and improve passenger screening, such as establishing a uniform Transportation Worker Identification Credential and developing the next-generation Computer Assisted Passenger Prescreening System (CAPPS II). These efforts face implementation challenges that will need to be addressed.

* Although TSA has focused on securing commercial aviation, vulnerabilities remain in areas such as air cargo, general aviation, and airport perimeter security. Legislative proposals have been introduced to address these potential vulnerabilities.

* TSA's efforts to strengthen aviation security face longer-term challenges in the areas of risk management, funding, coordination, strategic human capital management, and building a results-oriented organization. A risk management approach could help set strategic priorities and direct resources to the greatest needs.

* Key funding challenges include paying for increased aviation security costs and controlling those costs. Sustaining security advancements will require effective partnerships and coordination with federal, state, local, and private stakeholders.

* To support its large and diverse workforce, TSA needs to continue building a results-oriented culture and strategically manage its human capital. Challenges remain in sizing and training the screener workforce, completing background checks, and establishing a performance management system.

* It is important for TSA to maintain clear communication with Congress and stakeholders about its use of funds to ensure oversight and accountability. Continued investment in research and development and the use of risk assessments and plans that balance security and customer service will be key to improving aviation security.
</summary>

* The LDA and IRC lobbying definitions differ significantly in the types of activities and contacts counted as lobbying. LDA only covers lobbying of federal officials, while the IRC definitions also cover state and grassroots lobbying. The IRC definitions potentially cover contacts with more executive branch officials than LDA for legislation-related matters, but fewer officials for non-legislative matters.

* The definitions also differ in the subject matters considered lobbying. More specific information is needed to determine if a contact counts under the IRC definitions compared to LDA.

* The choice of definition impacts whether an organization must register under LDA and what information gets reported. • GAO has assessed strategic sourcing in federal acquisitions for over a decade, finding that agencies could achieve significant savings by leveraging buying power and reducing suppliers. However, most agencies only leveraged a small fraction of their spending through strategic sourcing as of 2012.
• Key challenges to strategic sourcing adoption include lack of detailed spending data, expertise, leadership support, and metrics. Some agencies have made progress by using available data, developing training, adding performance measures, and mandating use of strategic sourcing contracts.
• Federal agencies have been particularly reluctant to strategically source services, which account for over half of procurement spending. In contrast, leading companies strategically manage a full range of services and report saving 4-15% annually.
• Since 2012, OMB and agencies have taken actions to expand strategic sourcing, but much more could be done to incorporate leading practices, increase spending through strategic sourcing, and target high-spend categories like services. Adopting proven practices can help agencies achieve more with constrained budgets.
</summary>

Here is a 15-sentence summary of the text in 5 bullet points of 3 sentences each:

<summary>
* Current surface transportation programs are not effectively addressing the nation's transportation challenges. Most highway, transit, and safety funds are distributed through formulas that do not link to performance or needs. The programs often do not use the best tools or approaches, and their fiscal sustainability is in doubt due to increased spending without commensurate revenue increases.

* To address these issues, surface transportation programs should be restructured based on several key principles. Programs should have well-defined goals based on identified areas of national interest and a clearly defined federal role. Performance and accountability should be incorporated into funding decisions, and the best tools and approaches should be used to improve results and return on investment.

* Potential options to fund increased infrastructure investment include altering existing taxes and fees or introducing new ones. Examples include increasing fuel taxes, indexing fuel taxes to inflation, implementing vehicle miles traveled (VMT) fees, freight fees, or congestion pricing. Financing mechanisms such as bonds, loans, and public-private partnerships can also provide flexibility and leverage additional nonfederal investment.

* Highway public-private partnerships show promise but also entail potential costs and risks. More consistent, rigorous analysis of public interest considerations is needed when evaluating these partnerships. The federal government should develop objective criteria for identifying national interests in highway public-private partnerships.

* Ultimately, a fundamental reexamination and restructuring of surface transportation programs is needed to address current challenges. Funding sources and financing mechanisms should be tailored to programs that are relevant and address clear national interests. The outlined principles provide a framework for evaluating the various options and developing an effective national transportation policy for the 21st century.
</summary>

• SEC's financial management systems do not conform to OMB Circular A-127 requirements for system integration, common data elements, and consistent internal controls. This requires extensive compensating manual procedures and increases the risk of errors in financial data.

• Errors were found in SEC's calculation of disgorgement and penalty accounts receivable balances and in the recording of transaction fee revenue receivable at year-end. SEC also had numerous errors in its year-end financial statement disclosures.

• Despite progress, SEC still has weaknesses in information security controls over its financial systems and data. These weaknesses decrease assurance over data reliability and increase the risk of unauthorized access to financial information.

• SEC continues to have inaccuracies in its recorded property and equipment acquisition costs and dates, and lacks an integrated process for recording property and equipment transactions. Errors were also found in SEC's accounting for budgetary transactions related to undelivered orders and obligations.

• Tests of compliance with selected laws and regulations disclosed no reportable instances of noncompliance. However, the internal control weaknesses noted may result in misstatements in related performance information reported by SEC.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the source text in 9 bullet points of 2 sentences each:

<summary>
• The Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) of 1976 establishes policies for managing hazardous waste to minimize threats to human health and the environment. RCRA governs hazardous waste from generation to disposal, including waste from current and past industrial operations and cleanups.

• Three RCRA requirements - land disposal restrictions, minimum technological requirements, and permit requirements - can increase costs and delays for cleanups. These requirements can lead parties to choose less aggressive cleanup remedies that may be less protective.

• Land disposal restrictions prohibit disposing hazardous waste on land unless it is treated to meet stringent standards, which can be costly for large volumes of lightly contaminated waste. The restrictions may drive parties to use more expensive cleanup technologies than necessary.

• Minimum technological requirements establish design and operating specifications for hazardous waste treatment and disposal facilities. These requirements, designed for waste from ongoing industrial operations, may be more stringent than necessary for some lower-risk remediation waste.

• RCRA generally requires a permit for treating, storing, or disposing of hazardous waste. The permit process can be costly and time-consuming, especially for facilities that only need a permit for cleanup activities.

• To avoid triggering RCRA requirements, property owners may choose to let waste remain in place without treatment. Leaving high-concentration "old waste" in place may pose health or environmental risks.

• Since the late 1980s, EPA has modified RCRA's application to remediation waste through policy statements and regulatory alternatives. While these have provided some flexibility, states have found the alternatives burdensome to use.

• In 1996, EPA proposed new rules to comprehensively reform RCRA requirements for remediation waste. However, due to unresolved technical and legal issues, EPA plans to withdraw the proposal and pursue legislative reform instead.

• GAO recommends that until legislative reform is achieved, EPA should ensure cleanup regulators have a consistent understanding of how to apply existing RCRA alternatives. EPA agreed with the findings but noted that comprehensive reform of RCRA's entire hazardous waste management process is needed.
</summary>
