Gwen and Will set up a makeshift home in the building and find an old guitar, which Will encourages Gwen to play. Gwen sings a song, reflecting on her past dreams of being a musician.

* Lily takes a pregnancy test that comes back positive, surprising her and Holden. They discuss the unexpected but happy news, though Holden remains suspicious of Jade, a girl claiming to be the daughter of Lily's late sister Rose. Holden insists Jade take a blood test to prove her relation before the couple gets too invested.

* Paul is hiding out and sick, and Meg finds him after receiving a mysterious phone call. They argue about Paul's decision to let his family believe he is dead, with Meg insisting he needs medical attention. Despite the risks, Meg decides to stay and help Paul.

* Several couples celebrate Valentine's Day: Mike and Katie share heartfelt gifts before Mike leaves town, Jennifer and Dusty affirm their love and commitment to each other, and Jack surprises Carly at the police station before his partner Nick covers his shift so they can spend the evening together.
</summary>

Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 4 bullet points with 3 sentences each:

<summary>
* Mick Dante, who believes he is James Stenbeck, holds Casey, Alison, Paul, Emily, Barbara, and Henry hostage in a church during Casey and Alison's wedding. He forces them to play a cruel game of "truth or dare", revealing that Alison recently slept with him. Casey is devastated to learn of Alison's betrayal.
* Margo and Tom work with the police to try to rescue the hostages. Emily, Paul, Barbara and Henry attempt an escape but are caught by Mick. Paul stands up to Mick, declaring his love for Emily and refusing to let James control him any longer.
* Alison convinces Mick to leave with her in order to save the others. As they flee, Casey catches up to them and Margo arrives with the police. In a final confrontation, Mick is hit by a car and critically injured.
* In the aftermath, Paul and Emily reaffirm their love and decide they don't need a baby to complete them. Henry comforts Barbara, encouraging her to see her own strength and beauty. Casey, devastated by Alison's betrayal, tells his parents what happened and just wants to go home.
</summary>

Here is a 16-sentence summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
• Brad and Katie are trying to have a baby with the help of their friends Vienna and Henry. Vienna will be the surrogate mother carrying Brad's child. Brad has some initial trouble providing a sperm sample at the hospital, but Katie helps him relax by reminding him of their love.

• Henry is reluctant about the surrogacy and accidentally knocks over the tray with Brad's sperm sample. He admits to Vienna that he's jealous of the attention she will give to the baby. Vienna reassures Henry that he will always be number one in her heart.

• Luke returns to working at his foundation after encouragement from his grandmother Lucinda and boyfriend Noah. At a meeting, Luke stands up to a potential partner organization that doesn't want to support gay rights, and Brian, the foundation's former administrator, backs him up. Lily offers to take over as the new administrator of Luke's foundation.

• Brian visits Lucinda and they discuss their past relationship and Lucinda's health challenges. Brian has taken a job in Minneapolis but wants to remain friends with Lucinda, which she accepts. Back at Katie and Brad's, the four friends feel Vienna's stomach, hoping the surrogacy will be successful, and Brad says a prayer for the future baby.
</summary>

Here is a 21-sentence summary of the text in 7 bullet points, with 3 sentences each:

<summary>
* Jennifer missed most of the press conference for her Street Jeans relaunch, upsetting Dusty. Her family, including Barbara and Paul, offer to help with the business and wedding planning so she doesn't get overwhelmed. Jennifer agrees to let Barbara handle the wedding plans.

* Alison confronts Will about breaking into her apartment while she was away, which he denies. Will admits he came in through the window to get his keys and accidentally broke her perfume bottle, but insists he didn't rob her place. Alison decides she can't be friends with Will anymore as it's too much for her to handle.

* At the 1950s-themed dance, Casey is eager for Will and Alison to join him and Celia. Celia has a confrontation with some mean girls in the bathroom. Casey later finds out Celia told Alison that Will trashed her apartment, which upsets him since she has no proof.

* Lily and Keith attend the dance together, taking their relationship public. They run into Tom and Margo, who are competing in the dance contest. Holden and Jack also show up at the dance, with Holden confronting Lily about Keith's shady past and a man with a gun who is after Keith for money he owes.

* Lily doesn't believe Holden's accusations against Keith and asks him to leave. Jack suggests to Holden that he may be acting out of jealousy rather than genuine concern for their kids. Holden admits he may have overreacted seeing Lily with someone else but still has doubts about Keith.

* Jennifer and Mike share their engagement and pregnancy news with Barbara and Paul. They plan to get married quickly before Jennifer starts showing too much. Barbara is thrilled and offers to design Jennifer's wedding dress.

* Outside the dance, Keith is confronted by Vin, the man he owes money to. Vin warns Keith that he's watching him and implies he knows Keith is just using Lily for her money. Meanwhile, Lily confides in Margo that despite the difficult confrontation with Holden, she is enjoying her time with Keith and trying to move on from her marriage.
</summary>

Here is a 15-sentence summary of the text in 5 bullet points:

<summary>
• Paul and Rosanna are on the run with baby Eliza after Paul kidnapped her from Meg. Their car broke down and they have no money, but a kind diner owner lets them stay the night after Rosanna sings to calm the baby. Paul is determined not to give up his daughter.

• Dusty and Bonnie are searching for Paul and the baby, questioning people along the way. Bonnie uses her charm to get information that Paul was headed south on Route 6. Bonnie suddenly feels ill, so they stop at a motel for the night despite wanting to keep searching.

• Katie is pregnant with Brad's baby but had a health scare and fainted. The doctor says the baby is okay for now but Katie needs to avoid stress and be on bed rest for the rest of her pregnancy. Brad, Vienna and Henry all visit Katie in the hospital.

• With Katie unable to work, Kim agrees to give Brad his job back on "Oakdale Now". Vienna volunteers to be Brad's co-host which makes Henry jealous and uncomfortable. Brad and Vienna tape their first segment together which Henry and Katie watch from home.

• Paul and Rosanna don't know what to do next or where to go. Rosanna tries to reassure Paul as they settle in for the night in the back room of the diner. Meanwhile, Dusty looks after an ill Bonnie as she rests, and it's revealed that Barbara may know how to contact Paul.
</summary>

Here is a 15-sentence summary of the text in 5 bullet points:

<summary>

Bonnie's boyfriend Derek later sees the underwear and becomes jealous, accusing Bonnie of having a sexual encounter with Dusty, which she denies. Derek angrily leaves.

• Meg tells Damian she is giving Paul visitation rights to see their daughter Eliza, believing it's the right thing to do. Dusty later apologizes to Meg for telling her what to do regarding Paul, but becomes upset when he learns Meg is giving Paul more time with Eliza.

• Paul and Rosanna, who are exes, discuss Rosanna staying at Paul's place Fairwinds. Rosanna wants to find a job and be independent rather than relying on Paul. Paul encourages Rosanna to fight to get back the money Craig took from her, but Rosanna says she's let it go and changed.

• Carly tells Craig that her family wants him out of her life. Craig says he will convince Rosanna to give him a chance. Later, Craig tries to get Rosanna to approve of him seeing Carly, but Rosanna refuses.

• Paul sneaks into Craig's room at the Lakeview and uses his laptop to transfer money into a new account. Meanwhile, Rosanna talks to Carly, who hopes Rosanna can forgive Craig like she seems to have forgiven Paul. Rosanna is unsure but acknowledges people can change.
</summary>

Here is a 2-sentence summary of the text:

<summary>
* Carly and Jack get married in a Native American ceremony in Montana, surrounded by family and friends who offer their blessings and well-wishes for the couple.
* Meanwhile, Lily and Rose are trapped in a well but Rose manages to climb out, only to be confronted by Brackett who says they have "unfinished business".
</summary>

Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 3 bullet points with 4 sentences each:

<summary>
* Lily and Holden's son Ethan fell into a hole and was trapped. Paul went down the hole to rescue Ethan while Lily and Holden waited anxiously above ground. The rescue team was able to lift Ethan out safely using a harness, but then the hole collapsed further with Paul still inside. Meg was very worried about Paul and wanted to stay, but he convinced her to go home and rest for the baby's sake.

* Henry tracked down Vienna and Bonnie who were being held captive in a warehouse by Derek, who was working for James Stenbeck. Henry blew open the warehouse door to free them, but was injured in the explosion. Derek returned and drove an unconscious Henry and the women to the hospital, claiming he had no choice but to follow Stenbeck's orders. Henry later explained to Vienna and Bonnie that Stenbeck kidnapped them to keep his presence in Oakdale a secret.

* In a dream, James Stenbeck appeared to Meg and said the only way to save Paul was for her to sign over her baby to be his heir, claiming Paul was worthless to him. Paul discovered Derek was working with James all along and there was a secret tunnel to escape. The hole then completely collapsed with Paul inside. A distraught Meg woke up from the dream screaming for Paul.

Here is a summary of the text in 2 bullet points with 4 sentences each:

<summary>
* Liberty moves in with Paul and Emily to avoid the stress at home with her mom Janet over the baby adoption. Janet is very upset about this and argues with Emily, but Jack convinces Janet to let Liberty go for now. Janet later proposes that she and Jack adopt the baby themselves to keep it in the family, which Jack agrees to if Liberty agrees.

* At Adam's court hearing, key witness Maddie initially doesn't show up to testify because Casey convinced her not to, but Casey has a change of heart and gets Maddie to testify after all. Based on Maddie's testimony that she mistakenly thought Adam assaulted Gwen, the judge drops all charges against Adam. However, Casey secretly makes a deal with Adam that he will leave town for good in exchange for his freedom.
</summary>

Here is a 10-point summary of the text, with each point containing 2 sentences:

<summary>
• Carly reveals to Rosanna that she has a terminal brain tumor. Parker wants to use his trust fund to pay for an experimental treatment for Carly in Berlin, but Carly says it won't work for her type of tumor.
• Colonel Mayer apologizes to Luke and his family for his previous harsh behavior and prejudice. He claims to accept Noah being gay and wants to make amends, even suggesting the three of them go on a fishing trip together.
• Rosanna admits to Carly that she lied under oath about not remembering what Craig did to her, in order to keep Craig out of prison and away from Paul. Carly warns Rosanna that the truth will likely come out and lying could cost her Paul.
• Rosanna demands Craig get Meg pregnant to solidify their marriage and keep Meg away from Paul. Craig agrees and tries to convince Meg to fully commit to their marriage.
• Dusty, who was shot and left for dead by Colonel Mayer, asks Sly to deliver a message to Lily to rescue him. Sly confronts Colonel Mayer about shooting Dusty.
• Paul discovers evidence that Rosanna has been lying to him. He leaves Rosanna a message saying they need to be honest with each other.
• Meg decides to fully commit to her marriage with Craig. They agree to try to have a baby together.
• Carly tells Parker that the experimental treatment in Berlin won't work for her tumor. Parker still believes strongly that Carly will be fine.
• Noah is thrilled that his father seems to be accepting his relationship with Luke. Luke is still skeptical about Colonel Mayer's true feelings.
• Rosanna returns home to find Paul has left, leaving behind the cell phone video evidence of her lies. The video shows Paul's lingering feelings for Meg, leaving Rosanna's relationship with Paul uncertain.
</summary>

Here is a 4-sentence summary of the text in 2 bullet points:

<summary>

* Jack explains to the minister that even though he still loves Katie, he feels marrying Carly is the right thing to do given her illness and their family together. The minister questions if Carly has the strength to help Jack face the end, and she insists every minute with her family gives her strength to fight.
</summary>

Here is a 20-sentence summary of the text in 5 bullet points with 4 sentences each:

<summary>
• Ridge and Quinn discuss their secret from San Francisco, agreeing to keep it between them and never let it happen again. Quinn is worried about losing everything, but Ridge assures her he won't tell Eric what happened between them. They agree to try to support each other in this new understanding.

• Meanwhile, Liam is waiting for Steffy at his place, cooking her favorite mushroom risotto. Steffy is late and not answering her phone, causing Liam to become increasingly frustrated. He tells Bill he is considering leaving town and borrowing the jet if Steffy doesn't show up soon.

• Steffy and Wyatt visit a doctor to have their wedding band tattoos removed. The painful laser removal process is worse for Wyatt. Afterwards, Wyatt gives Steffy the finalized divorce papers, and they reminisce about their marriage.

Here is a 14-sentence summary of the text in 7 bullet points:

<summary>

* Jackie introduces her new designer "Madame X" to Nick, who is actually Bridget in disguise. Jackie wants to create a persona and backstory for Madame X to generate buzz.

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points, with 2 sentences per bullet point:

<summary>
* Nicole prepares for her wedding to Zende with her mother Vivienne and sister Maya. Zende's parents Kristen and Tony arrive and congratulate their son.
* Pam and Charlie prepare the wedding cake and food. Sally and Shirley Spectra arrive with their own cake, pretending to be caterers in order to crash the wedding.

* Eric notices Quinn seems jealous that Nicole's portrait has replaced hers, but he reassures her she is the only one in his heart. Ridge is still uncomfortable with Quinn's presence.
* Sasha, Nicole's half-sister, wishes Nicole well before the wedding. The two share a moment as sisters despite their complicated history.

* Maya helps Nicole get ready and tells her how blessed and deserving she is of this happy day. Nicole feels grateful for everyone in her life.
* As the Wedding March begins, Carter welcomes everyone and says how fitting it is to celebrate Zende and Nicole's love on Valentine's Day. The ceremony is about to start.

Here is a 24-sentence summary of the text in 6 bullet points with 4 sentences each:

<summary>
* Wyatt tells Sally that his father Bill wants him to return to work at Spencer Publications. Sally is concerned given her past issues with Bill, who destroyed her company Spectra Fashions. However, Wyatt says he will only consider going back if Bill resurrects Spectra with Sally as lead designer. Wyatt puts his commitment to Sally above everything else.

* Katie tells her sister Donna that Thorne ended their marriage and gave her annulment papers before returning to Paris. Donna asks Katie if she still has feelings for Bill Spencer. Just then, Bill arrives to check on Katie and Will after hearing about the annulment from Wyatt.

* Bill expresses his concern for Katie and Will, saying he is there for them as family. He uses a sports analogy about an injured basketball player to help explain Thorne's situation to Will. Katie notes that Thorne left not just because of his grief over Aly and Darla, but also because he thought Katie was still in love with Bill.

* Will arrives home and Bill reiterates that he will always be there for Will and Katie as family. Meanwhile, Justin arranges a secret meeting with Donna in Bill's office. He wants to ask her something about Bill and Katie, noting he hasn't seen Bill happier than when he was with them.

* Sally tells Wyatt she is touched by his concern but doesn't want him to give up the Spencer opportunity for her sake. She is happy with him and her position at Forrester. However, Wyatt believes Sally can accomplish even more on her own and that the setbacks with Bill only made her stronger.

* Wyatt feels it's Sally's time to shine and sees an incredible future for her. Sally says Wyatt's love and support mean more than any success. He changed her life by convincing her to keep pursuing design. She knows her future will be bright as long as Wyatt is in it, and she loves him deeply.
</summary>

Here is a 3-sentence summary of the text:

* Hope and Steffy argue about Steffy pursuing Liam during the 6-month waiting period before Liam and Steffy's divorce is finalized.

* Liam wants Hope to come stay with him so they can start their lives together now, but Hope hesitates.

Here is a 4-sentence summary of the text in 2 bullet points:

<summary>

• A distraught Taylor accuses Brooke of being behind Nick's actions, vowing that Brooke will not take her baby like she took her previous husbands. Rick comforts an upset Taylor and promises to not let them take Jack away from her.

Here is a 14-sentence summary of the text in 7 bullet points:

<summary>
* Liam is feeling sad about being separated from Hope and Beth, even though he gets to spend time with them. Steffy comforts Liam and tells him to focus on the love of his daughters.

Here is a 2-sentence summary of the text:

Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 4 bullet points:

<summary>
* Steffy and Liam are preparing to leave for their wedding in Australia. They are excited to have their family and friends joining them on the trip. The car is waiting to take them to the airport.

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points, with 2 sentences per bullet point:

<summary>

Here is a 6-sentence summary of the text:

Here is a 24-sentence summary of the text in 6 bullet points with 4 sentences each:

* Dante, Lulu, and John McBain are attempting to defuse a bomb that Jerry attached to the case containing the antiserum. With no time left and the bomb squad providing little help, McBain stays behind to try to disarm it himself by cutting the red wire, while Dante and Lulu seek cover.

* On the boat, Jax tries to reason with Jerry and offers to help him, but Jerry pulls a gun on Jax. Sonny arrives and shoots Jerry, saving Jax. The scene ends with gunfire and the bomb's timer still counting down.
</summary>

Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 3 bullet points with 4 sentences each:

<summary>
* Morgan is determined to kill Julian for shooting Sonny, and has obtained a gun from Milo. Michael and Carly are worried and trying to find Morgan before he does something reckless that ruins his life. Michael goes to look for Morgan while Carly stays with Sonny at the hospital. Kristina is also concerned that Alexis could be with Julian and caught in the crossfire.

* Alexis rented a secluded cabin for her and Julian to spend time together, but now wants Julian to hide out there alone for his safety. TJ overheard Alexis telling Julian about the cabin. When Morgan comes to Alexis' house looking for Julian, TJ refuses to reveal Julian's location despite Morgan's desperate pleas. Michael arrives looking for Morgan.

* Ava is furious to learn the incriminating recording of her is missing and pressures Scott to get it back. Paul Hornsby, an old law school acquaintance of the mayor, gets Dillon's movie cease and desist order lifted. Paul shows up at Ava's place claiming he can help her. Meanwhile, Patrick proposes to Sam on his birthday.
</summary>

Here is a 28-sentence summary of the text in 7 bullet points with 4 sentences each:

<summary>

* Sonny and Kate are about to get married, but there are several interruptions during the ceremony. Olivia objects at first, but then gives her blessing. Milo also objects but is stopped by Max. The judge asks multiple times if anyone objects before proceeding.

* Meanwhile, Jason learns from Elizabeth that she deliberately gave him the wrong DNA test results showing Sam's baby had died. In reality, the test proved Sam's baby is alive and is the child being raised by Téa Delgado. Elizabeth admits she lied because she wanted a chance with Jason and didn't want the baby to bring him and Sam back together.

* Trey goes to Sam's place looking for Kristina after they had a fight. He leaves her a note before departing. Later, Elizabeth shows up and tells Sam that she and Jason are not actually together, and she had lied when Sam overheard her conversation with Lulu.

* Kristina has been taken hostage by Joe Scully Jr., the father of her husband Trey. Joe reveals he hates Sonny and orchestrated Kristina and Trey's marriage as a way to get revenge on him. He plans to kill Kristina and frame one of Sonny's mob enemies for the murder.

* Joe explains that with Kristina dead, Trey will inherit everything from her. This is Joe's twisted way of finally defeating Sonny and getting what he believes Sonny owes him. Kristina tries to reason with Joe, but he is determined to go through with his deadly plan.

* As Sonny and Kate are about to say their vows, Kate suddenly objects to the marriage herself. She announces in front of everyone that she cannot marry Sonny because she is already married. This shocks Sonny and all the guests.

* Jason tells John McBain about the DNA test proving Sam's baby is alive. McBain agrees they need to take action but worries about how much this revelation will hurt Téa, who loves the little boy she has been raising as her own. They see Téa and realize the difficult road ahead.

</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 2 bullet points, with 4 sentences each:

<summary>
* Claudia and Johnny discuss her impending marriage to Sonny, which Claudia claims is a business deal that will benefit the Zacchara organization and Johnny's future position. Johnny is opposed to the marriage, believing Sonny will mistreat Claudia and could find out the truth about their involvement in Michael's shooting. Claudia insists it's her choice and the marriage will give her power, while Anthony approves, calling Johnny naive for his disapproval. Johnny declares he doesn't want the organization that Claudia is sacrificing herself for.

* Elizabeth, her sons, and Sam arrive at a remote cabin to hide from the Russian mob. After changing a flat tire on the way, they discover the cabin's phone lines have been cut and there is no cell signal. Sam goes outside to get firewood but rushes back in to warn Elizabeth that the Russians have found them and they are on their own with no way to call for help.
</summary>

Here is a 36-sentence summary of the text in 9 bullet points with 4 sentences each:

<summary>
* Jason and Sam discuss Franco, an artist who seems obsessed with Jason. Franco has been leaving clues for Jason to find him. Sam is worried it may be a trap, but Jason insists on confronting Franco to find out what he knows about Michael killing Claudia.

* Sonny and Carly argue about how to handle the situation with Michael. Carly wants to go to the police and confess that Michael killed Claudia in self-defense. Sonny is adamantly against this, believing it will ruin Michael's life and make him a target. They reach an impasse.

* Johnny is upset that Olivia is still in love with Sonny. He feels like a fool for staying with her despite her divided feelings. Olivia says she can't change how she feels and Johnny needs to either accept her as she is or end their relationship. Johnny decides to stay with her.

* Dominic recognizes graffiti tags that match some he saw in New York City near a crime scene. He enlists Lulu's help to access police records to identify the tagger. Lulu distracts an officer at the station so Dominic can look up the information.

* Lucky takes Rebecca's statement about the car accident with Nikolas. Ethan accuses Nikolas of deliberately running Rebecca over after breaking up with her. Lucky defends Nikolas, saying there's no evidence it was intentional. Rebecca tells Nikolas' brother Steve she realized Nikolas never truly wanted her.

* Elizabeth is upset to find her brother Steve talking to Rebecca. She worries Rebecca will tell Steve something damaging about her. Steve later advises Rebecca to either work things out with Elizabeth or agree to let their conflict go. Rebecca appreciates Steve's kindness.

* Maxie wants to redecorate Jason and Spinelli's apartment. Sam realizes Maxie is overcompensating because something happened with Franco. Maxie admits she had a "momentary lapse in judgment" with Franco that she doesn't want Spinelli to know about. Sam chastises Maxie for only caring about herself when Jason is out risking his life confronting Franco.

* Ethan visits Rebecca in the hospital and offers support

Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 6 bullet points:

<summary>
• Maxie is struggling with losing custody of her baby to Spinelli. Robin encourages Maxie to think carefully about letting Spinelli take the baby to Portland, but Maxie insists it's for the best.

• Franco confesses to Dr. Kevin Collins that he killed his mother Heather Webber to protect Carly. Kevin agrees to take Franco on as a patient to help him figure out who he is now.

• Lulu blames Dante for them losing custody of the baby, pushing him away in her grief. Carly and Sonny both encourage Lulu and Dante to support each other through this difficult time.

• Lucy agrees to reconcile with Kevin and fix their marriage. She decides not to tell Kevin that she slept with Scott, at Scott's urging.

• Spinelli has decided to accept a job in Portland and move there with his girlfriend Ellie and the baby. He shares an emotional reunion with Robin, who has returned from the dead.

• Dante suggests to Lulu that they should try to have another baby to start healing after losing Connie. Lulu seems uncertain about the idea.
</summary>

Here is a 14-sentence summary of the text in 7 bullet points:

<summary>
• Alexis is appointed to defend Manny Ruiz against her wishes. Despite believing he is guilty, she decides to take on the case after learning his criminal behavior may have been caused by a brain anomaly.

• Carly is not allowed to leave Roselawn for Christmas, upsetting her and her children. She asks Courtney to fill in for her, but Sonny objects to Courtney bringing Nikolas.

• Michael asks Emily to come for Christmas to cheer up Morgan. Emily agrees and helps decorate the tree at Sonny's house.

• Nikolas gives Lulu a diamond necklace for Christmas, fulfilling a childhood wish. He leaves town on business but plans to return to spend Christmas with Courtney.

• Robin and Patrick argue over Manny's treatment and whether he can be held responsible for his past crimes. Robin believes Manny deserves a chance to start over.

• Ric is frustrated when Alexis cancels their plans to get a Christmas tree together due to her new case. Alexis insists she has no choice but to work.

• In a dream or fantasy, Carly imagines celebrating a happy Christmas together with Sonny and their children. In reality, Sonny, Emily, Michael and Morgan decorate the tree without Carly.
</summary>

Here is a 4-sentence summary of the text:

<summary>
• Gus confronts Natalia about keeping their son Rafe a secret from him for 16 years.
• Rafe is in juvenile detention and finds out Gus is his father, leaving him confused and upset.
• Beth is feeling smothered by Alan's obsession over their unborn child and tries to get some space.
• Reva publicly confronts Alan for bouncing a check he wrote for her cancer research fundraiser.
</summary>

Here is an 8-bullet point summary of the text:

<summary>
• Lizzie tells Ava to leave after learning she went to a fertility clinic, but Bill insists the wedding will still happen.
• Rick cancels the annual Bauer barbecue, feeling down about his breakup with Beth.
• Josh and Cassie decide to host the Bauer barbecue at their place to keep the tradition going.
• Bill asks Ava to pretend to be a happy couple at the barbecue, but secretly tells Lizzie he still loves her.
• Remy confronts Ava about the baby not being Bill's after Lizzie tells him the truth.
• Alan falls but decides to attend the Bauer barbecue anyway, saying it's the right thing to do.
• Rick shows up at the barbecue and gives a short speech, thanking everyone for coming.
• Mallet gives a patriotic speech about the meaning of the Fourth of July holiday and what brings everyone together.
</summary>

Here is an 8-point summary of the text:

<summary>
* Cassie and Jeffrey have a scheduling conflict between RJ's party and Jeffrey's awards dinner.
* Edmund offers to supervise RJ's party so Cassie can go with Jeffrey, but Cassie refuses.
* Dinah agrees to tell Cassie that Edmund never kidnapped her in exchange for sex with Edmund.
* Jonathan gets into a fight with Sandy at the bar, and Reva breaks it up.
* Reva realizes Alfred (Nate) has been abusing Jonathan and likely killed Olivia's sister Marissa.
* Reva and Olivia agree to work together to get justice for Jonathan and Marissa.
* Sandy breaks up with Tammy, feeling Jonathan has come between them.
* Reva asks for her bartending job back from Nate in order to keep an eye on him.
</summary>

Here is a 12-sentence summary of the text in 3 bullet points of 4 sentences each:

<summary>
• Alan confesses to shooting his son Phillip in order to protect his family, but claims it was entrapment when confronted by the others. Lizzie is devastated to learn her grandfather killed her father. Alexandra reveals she has physical evidence - gloves with powder burns and Phillip's blood on them - linking Alan to the murder. Alan is arrested by Frank for Phillip's murder.

• Dinah is heartbroken over losing the baby girl she was carrying for Edmund. Jonathan tries to comfort her, telling her it's best not to want things you can't have or let yourself be vulnerable to getting hurt. Dinah asks to be alone, and Jonathan advises her to hurt others before they can hurt her.

• Cassie refuses to reunite with Edmund, saying they've been through too much to go back, and need to find a way to be civil for their baby's sake. Edmund is about to tell Cassie something important when Dinah shows up still pretending to be pregnant. Cassie asks what's going on and Edmund claims the baby is fine.
</summary>

Here is a 21-sentence summary of the text in 7 bullet points, with 3 sentences each:

<summary>
• Shayne is overwhelmed by his newfound baseball fame and just wants to spend time with Marina before leaving for training camp. Marina is supportive but Lizzie tries to stir up trouble by mentioning Marina visited Ben in the hospital. Shayne gets a special sandwich named after him at Buzz's diner.

• Gus confronts Eden on a rooftop, suspecting she is connected to the recent murders. Eden admits Renee's actions with the coroner put her escort service business in danger with the mob, giving her motive. Gus tells Eden to give him something to prove her innocence or turn herself in.

• Alexandra asks Edmund for help going after Jeffrey O'Neill, but Edmund refuses, wanting to focus on making Cassie's dreams come true by restoring her family farm. Alexandra warns Edmund that Jeffrey, who resembles Cassie's late husband Richard, is a threat living under Cassie's roof. Cassie overhears part of their conversation.

• Ben suddenly recalls the cologne scent of his attacker matches Mitch Hendon's, leading Gus to seek a warrant for Mitch's arrest. Gus allows Ben to visit his dying grandmother with a police escort but still suspects Ben may be guilty of something. Ross informs Mitch he must turn himself in.

• Eden is upset that Gus, Bill, and Tony seem to think the worst of her regarding the murders and her business. Tony apologizes for his earlier accusations and offers to help prove Eden's innocence. Eden feels no one believes she is telling the truth except Tony.

• Jeffrey is evicted from the Beacon Hotel by Cassie for his rude comments. He calls to arrange careful handling of some "merchandise" that needs to be picked up. Cassie goes to check on the progress of moving Jeffrey's belongings out of the hotel.

• Mitch asks Ross for time to call Ramona's family before turning himself in. Cassie enters a room at the Beacon and finds Mitch there. In the next episode, Mitch will apparently be on the hotel roof, telling Cassie that no one can stop him.
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points, with 3 sentences each:

<summary>
• Alexandra and Cyrus discuss the fundraiser event, with Cyrus secretly planning to steal the donation money. Cyrus has his accomplice Griggs on the other end of an earpiece, reading off account numbers from donation checks so Griggs can transfer the funds. Marina arrives on police detail and becomes suspicious of Cyrus's behavior.

• Gus and Natalia attend the event together and share a dance, though there is tension between them over Natalia's friendship with Alan. Alan implies to Gus that he is interested in pursuing Natalia. Gus pulls Natalia away to dance, leaving Alan alone.

• Dinah arrives with Mallet but becomes upset seeing her mother Vanessa with Billy. Matt also shows up, causing awkwardness. Mallet tries to comfort Dinah and expresses his commitment to her.

• Frank confronts Mallet about money he found in Mallet's desk, suspecting him of theft. Mallet admits he considered taking the money due to financial hardship from Dinah's medical bills, but claims he didn't spend any of it. Frank is unsure whether to report Mallet.

• Harley lectures Cyrus about stringing Marina along while married to Alexandra, saying it's unfair to both women. Cyrus seems to consider her words. Meanwhile, Cyrus continues secretly reading off account numbers to Griggs.

• Dinah has a private conversation with Matt outside, telling him she's decided to pursue a relationship with him despite her feelings for Mallet. She says she doesn't want to miss out on the chance to be with Matt. It's unclear if she means it or has an ulterior motive.

• Mallet frantically searches for Dinah. Alexandra and Vanessa commiserate about the men in their lives disappointing them and leaving them alone at the party. There is an implication the two women have a history.

• Marina confronts Cyrus, revealing she overheard him reading off account numbers, including her own. She accuses him of planning to rob all the party guests, not just the Spauldings, and vows to stop him. Cyrus claims she misunderstood but appears caught

Here is a summary of the text in 6 bullet points of 3 sentences each:

<summary>
* Lizzie is released from the hospital and insists on staying with Bill despite her family wanting her to go to China for business. Bill encourages Lizzie to go to China to save the business deal they worked hard on. Lizzie reluctantly agrees to go but makes Bill promise to prove his innocence while she's gone.

* Reva is worried about Shayne, who left the hospital and is avoiding his family. Josh tracks down Shayne and tries to get him to open up, but Shayne resists his help. Shayne makes plans to leave town as soon as possible to avoid burdening Reva.

* Reva and Jeffrey meet with a doula to help Reva through her high-risk pregnancy. Jeffrey is concerned about the stress Shayne is causing Reva on top of her cancer. Shayne feels guilty but still plans to leave, thinking it will be better for Reva.

* Beth is torn between her growing feelings for Coop and pressure from Alan to go to China with him for Christmas. Coop invites Beth to go away with him after Christmas, but she hesitates. Beth lies and tells Alan she has a law workshop so she doesn't have to go to China.

* Buzz warns Coop about the dangers of getting involved with Beth and making an enemy of Alan Spaulding. Coop insists it's not about Alan or Buzz and that he can live his life how he wants. Buzz fears Alan's power and influence if he finds out about Coop and Beth.

* Remy confides in Shayne about losing his wife Ava and their baby. Mel tries to convince Remy not to rush into divorcing his friend Christina, who he married to help her stay in the country. Remy resists Mel's advice, not ready to consider dating again after Ava.
</summary>

Here is a 2-sentence summary of the text in bullet point format:

<summary>
• Blair forgives Todd for his past mistakes and tells him she loves him and wants to be with him.
• Asa and Rae argue over their divorce settlement, with Rae tricking Asa into agreeing to give her 90% of his fortune.
</summary>

Here is a 10-sentence summary of the text in 5 bullet points:

<summary>
• Jessica brings her baby Chloe to the cemetery to visit Nash's grave before Chloe's christening. She tells Chloe that even though Nash is gone, she has many people who will look after her, including her Aunt Natalie and Uncle Jared.

• At the christening, Natalie and Jared promise as Chloe's godparents to protect Jessica from ever finding out that her own baby died and that Chloe is actually the biological daughter of Starr and Cole. They vow to take this secret to their graves.

• Cole finds the necklace with Hope's picture that Starr lost and returns it to her. Starr reveals to Cole that their baby Hope did not actually die from Rh disease as they had been told.

• Todd and Téa sleep together, but afterwards Téa refuses to help Todd win back custody of his kids from Blair and John McBain, despite Todd thinking they had a deal. Téa implies she is fine with their fling being a one-time thing, leaving Todd wanting more.

• Police find a knife with Blair's blood on it in Zach Rosen's motel room. However, the fingerprint on the knife does not belong to Rosen - shockingly, it matches John McBain.
</summary>

Here is a 6-bullet point summary of the text:

<summary>

* Natalie tells Rex and Gigi that Marty Saybrooke was pushed down a flight of stairs and lost her baby, with Todd as the main suspect.
* Dani confronts Todd in the hospital about pushing Marty, and Todd insists he is innocent and wants a chance to be her father.
* Téa argues with Blair, saying she needs to defend Todd so he can connect with Dani in case something happens to Téa.
* Markko discovers that Langston has been cheating on him with his teaching assistant Ford and they break up.
* Rex receives a call that the necklace he is searching for to find his birth parents was made by a silversmith in Santa Fe.
</summary>

Here is a 20-sentence summary of the text in 10 bullet points:

<summary>

• David overhears Kelly wishing her brother Paul were dead and offers to take care of Paul for her. Dr. Long insists to John that the organ harvesting documents are legitimate.

• Michael finds Dr. Long with an expensive heart and asks who the recipient is. David accuses Paul of trying to hurt Kelly and they get into a physical altercation, with Paul passing out.
</summary>

Here is a 9-sentence summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

<summary>
• John plays a recording of a baby crying for Miles to listen to, suspecting Miles knows more about Todd's disappearance than he's letting on. Miles claims ignorance and is anxious to leave for a meeting, raising John's suspicions further. John decides to follow Miles after he leaves.

• Marty runs out of gas and is attacked by three men, but she fends them off with mace. Miles happens to drive by shortly after, followed by John, who is suspicious of the coincidence. John takes Marty to the police station to file a report while Miles meets with the men who attacked Marty, revealing he hired them to stage the attack but not hurt her.

• Jessica tells Nash she ended her marriage to Antonio because she's in love with Nash. Antonio lashes out at Cristian for not telling him sooner about Jessica and Nash's affair. Meanwhile, Viki and Clint discuss Jessica's dire need for a liver transplant and vow to explore every option to help her.
</summary>

Here is a 20-sentence summary of the text in 10 bullet points:

<summary>
* Clint is upset that Dorian left him to confront Viki about having David Vickers stay at her house. Dorian apologizes and asks Clint to remember the good times they had together while they spend some time apart.

* Viki offers to let David stay at her house if he gives up trying to seduce her and agrees to wear clothes. They end up watching a Cary Grant movie together and David falls asleep on the couch.

* Marty refuses to stay at a hotel with John for protection from Miles, insisting she needs to handle the situation her own way to protect John's job. She leaves to attend Cole's high school play.

* When Marty returns home, she finds Miles acting suspiciously, out of breath and sweaty. He claims he was doing pushups and offers her wine, but she declines and leaves for the play.

* Sarah, who had been hiding Todd, calls Blair and reveals that her boyfriend Hunter moved Todd to an unknown location. Blair, Cristian, and Rex try to get Sarah to give them more information.

* Blair reluctantly agrees to return to Llanview after Cristian reminds her that her children need her. Rex and Cristian decide to stay in Chicago to keep investigating.

* Michael tells Marcie he wants to have another baby, preferably a girl. Marcie says she'd like to wait until Tommy is older and she's more settled in her teaching job.

* Miles meets with Hunter, who has brought a seemingly unconscious Todd to Miles' apartment. Miles pays Hunter and tells him to leave, realizing that Todd is still alive.

* John goes to a bar, where the bartender notices he seems upset after Marty left. John brushes off the bartender's attempt to console him.
</summary>

<summary>

* Viki confronts Marcie about her role in the Killing Club murders, blaming her for putting Natalie in danger. Marcie apologizes and says she never meant for any of this to happen in real life. Viki tells Marcie to stop feeling sorry for herself and do something to help the police find Natalie. Marcie reveals that the killer is copying ideas from the original Killing Club journals she and her friends wrote in high school.

* John puts the police task force on the search for Natalie while investigating the other murders. Bo gives him more officers to help and asks about Evangeline, who John says probably doesn't want to see him right now. Nora advises John to keep his distance from Evangeline for a while. Bo notices Nora seems off and asks what's wrong.

The man rudely rejects her, calling her "bridge and tunnel" and suggesting she go to an all-you-can-eat place instead. An angry Tess steals the keys to the man's expensive car from the valet stand and speeds off in it while the man is inside the restaurant.

* Rex is frustrated trying to get information from the police about the search for Natalie. Lindsay comforts him as he blames himself for Natalie's kidnapping, since he wrote a fake note to get John to rescue her, thinking it would bring them closer together. Lindsay assures Rex he's a changed man and a good person, and that Natalie's abduction is not his fault.

* Nora tells Bo she had to take an HIV test because of her relationship with Daniel Colson. Bo is supportive and optimistic her results will be negative. Nora later returns and informs Bo the test was negative, but she'll need to be retested for up to 6 months to be sure. They discuss their son Matthew and hope Natalie will be found soon.

* Antonio receives a note from Jessica via Todd saying she is okay but needs time and he shouldn't look for her. Viki arrives and demands to know if Jessica is alright. Antonio and Tod

Here is a 9-sentence summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

Marcie and Rex are captured by the Killing Club Killer, Hayes Barber, who sets up a deadly trap for them. John and Bo try to get information from a wounded accomplice named Nick on where Natalie and the others are being held.

Starr feels like an outcast at school due to her family's past with Margaret Cochran, but Blair reassures her. Adriana is worried about Rex, who has been kidnapped by the Killing Club Killer.

Here is a 24-sentence summary of the text in 6 bullet points with 4 sentences each:

<summary>

Marcie dedicates a radio show to Al, as Larry informs Max and Gabrielle that Al will need a liver transplant to survive.

Here is a 7-point summary of the text:

Here is a 21-sentence summary of the text in 7 bullet points, with 3 sentences each:

Dr. Watkins encourages Sharon that she can get through this challenging time and find a real purpose beyond just being in love. Here is a summary of the text in 8 bullet points, with 3 sentences per bullet point:

Here is a 6-sentence summary of the text in 3 bullet points:

He recognizes that he cannot change the past but must accept Cassie's death and the damage it has caused.

• Cassie tells Nick he needs to stop saying "what if", figure out what he wants, and not give up on putting his life back together. Promising Cassie he will try to move forward, Nick goes to Sharon and tells her he is moving back home to be with her and their son.

Here is a 10-point summary of the text, with each point containing 2 sentences:

<summary>
* John Abbott is in the hospital after suffering a minor stroke while in prison. His family, including his wife Gloria and children Jack and Ashley, are worried about his condition.
* The doctor informs them that John was having vision problems and a CT scan revealed the stroke, but they got him to the hospital quickly and have started treatment.
* Gloria is the first to visit John in his room, and he reassures her that he will be home soon. He expresses his love for her and tells her not to worry.
* Ashley visits next and tells John that the Governor will likely commute his sentence, allowing him to come home. John says he feels blessed to have such a loving and supportive family.
* Jack visits and insists they will do whatever it takes to keep John from going back to prison, even if it means keeping him in the hospital until the papers are signed. John starts having trouble breathing and the nurse makes Jack leave.
* Meanwhile, Lily returns home to her parents Neil and Dru after leaving her husband Daniel. Tensions are high between Neil and Dru as they argue about how to handle the situation with Lily.
* Neil wants to push Lily to get an annulment immediately while the pain is fresh, but Dru thinks they need to be more supportive and not pressure her. They end up in a heated argument about their own relationship issues.
* Lily goes to Crimson Lights to get away from her parents' fighting and runs into Daniel. She confides in him about the tense situation at home and feeling like she has no one to trust anymore.
* Back at the hospital, the Abbott family waits for news on John's condition. Jack tells them he had to leave because John was having trouble breathing.
* Suddenly, a "Code Blue" is announced for John's room, indicating a medical emergency. The family rushes to see what is happening as a doctor emerges with a grim expression, telling Gloria "I'm sorry."
</summary>

Here is a summary of the text in 4 bullet points, with 2 sentences each:
